bill_title: remove certain sanctions regarding public assistance for certain felony drug offenders.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to remove certain sanctions regarding public assistance for certain felony drug offenders. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That ARSD 67:10:01:13 be repealed. 67:10:01:13...Individual ineligible if convicted of certain offenses. An individual is ineligible for assistance under this article if the individual is convicted of a felony under federal or state law which felony has as an element the possession, use, or distribution of a controlled substance. An individual applying for assistance must, during the application process, state in writing on a form available from the department whether the individual or any member of the individual's household has been convicted of such a crime. This section does not apply to convictions which occurred before August 23, 1996. Section 2. That chapter 28-7A be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Pursuant to section 21 U.S.C. § 862a(d)(1)(A), South Dakota opts out of the provisions of section 21 U.S.C. § 62a(a)(1). A person with a felony conviction under state or federal law may be eligible to receive assistance under chapter 28-7A. The Department shall promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, regarding eligibility under this section.
